meanings.definition: To fasten or close with a zipper.
meanings.sent1: She was zippering her jacket before going outside.
meanings.sent2: I always zippering my bag to keep everything secure.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was zippering up and down the tree trunk, looking for nuts.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to zippering the cards together with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent5: The sound of zippering filled the room as everyone prepared for the trip.

meanings.definition: The act of joining or connecting two things together in a fast and efficient manner.
meanings.sent1: The zippering of the two parts made the machine work perfectly.
meanings.sent2: His expertise in zippering metal pieces impressed the team.
meanings.sent3: The zippering of ideas between the two colleagues led to a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent4: The zippering of friendship between them was evident in their constant support.
meanings.sent5: The zippering of the puzzle pieces revealed a beautiful picture.

meanings.definition: The process of moving quickly or smoothly in a zigzag pattern.
meanings.sent1: The zippering of the skier down the slope was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The zippering of the snake through the grass caught our attention.
meanings.sent3: The zippering of the river around the bend created a calming effect.
meanings.sent4: The zippering of the car through traffic was like a dance.
meanings.sent5: The zippering of the kite in the sky brought joy to the children.
